Class VCENDayCycleDisplay

  • java.lang.Object
    • greenfoot.Actor
      • VCENDayCycleDisplay
  • public class VCENDayCycleDisplay
extends greenfoot.Actor
    VCENDayCycleDisplay is a Greenfoot Actor that displays time. The time is displayed through visuals in a rectangular box: a sun rises and sets, and a moon does the same within it.

    The time is split into four stages: dawn, day, dusk, and night. Altogether, the four stages make one cycle.
    The default length a cycle is 2400. This number, however, is completely arbitrary, as one can have time increase by 1, 50, or 1000 every second, thus changing the length of time it takes to pass one cycle.

    When updating the display, one can input a time to update the display. This value can be any integer. The class determines which stage (dawn, day, dusk, night) the time belongs to and adjusts the visuals accordingly.
    Example: with a cycle of 2400, and a given time of 4700, it will be night.
    The given time is not like time on a clock which cycles from 12:00am to 11:59pm. Rather, the given time can be thought of as time passed from the start.

    The default size of the display box is 40x200 pixels, but the display box can be any size other than 0x0 pixels.

    Each time stage is depicted through different background colours, which can be customized. The default colours are pink, blue, purple, and (very) dark blue for dawn, day, dusk, and night respectively.

    Version:
    4 (11/3/2020)
    Author:
    Vanessa Chiu, Evan Ng

        public VCENDayCycleDisplay​(int width,
                           int height,
                           int borderThickness)

        Parameters:
        width - Width of display bar, must be greater than 0
        height - Height of display bar, must be greater than 0
        borderThickness - Width of border, cannot be negative

      • VCENDayCycleDisplay

        public VCENDayCycleDisplay​(int timeNow,
                           int oneDayLength,
                           int dayTimeStart,
                           int duskTimeStart,
                           int nightTimeStart)
        Constructor that takes five ints - changes the length of a day and adjusts when the day, dusk, or night starts.
        Dawn is set to 0 (dawn always starts the day cycle)

        Warning: setting dayTimeStart to 0 will remove dawn. However, this is not recommended, because the visuals look less appealing. Similarily, setting duskTimeStart to dayTimeStart removes day, nightTimeStart to duskTimeStart removes dusk, and nightTimeStart to oneDayLength removes night. These are all not recommended actions.

        Parameters:
        timeNow - Time now
        oneDayLength - Length of a day (cycle), cannot be negative
        dayTimeStart - Time when day starts, must be between 0 and oneDayLength
        duskTimeStart - Time when dusk starts, must be between dayTimeStart and oneDayLength
        nightTimeStart - Time when night starts, must be between duskTimeStart and oneDayLength

      • VCENDayCycleDisplay

        public VCENDayCycleDisplay​(int timeNow,
                           int oneDayLength,
                           int dayTimeStart,
                           int duskTimeStart,
                           int nightTimeStart,
                           int numberOfStars,
                           int width,
                           int height,
                           int borderThickness)
        Constructor that takes nine ints - they determine at what time the display starts, adjust the length of a day, when day, dusk, and night starts, and the size of the display the border.

        Dawn is set to 0 (dawn always starts the day cycle).

        Warning: setting dayTimeStart to 0 will remove dawn. However, this is not recommended, because the visuals look less appealing. Similarily, setting duskTimeStart to dayTimeStart removes day, nightTimeStart to duskTimeStart removes dusk, and nightTimeStart to oneDayLength removes night. These are all not recommended actions.

        Parameters:
        timeNow - Time now
        oneDayLength - Length of a day (cycle), cannot be negative
        dayTimeStart - Time when day starts, must be between 0 and oneDayLength
        duskTimeStart - Time when dusk starts, must be between dayTimeStart and oneDayLength
        nightTimeStart - Time when night starts, must be between duskTimeStart and oneDayLength
        numberOfStars - Number of stars that appear at night, cannot be negative
        width - Width of display bar, must be greater than 0
        height - Height of display bar, must be greater than 0
        borderThickness - Width of border, cannot be negative

      • VCENDayCycleDisplay

        public VCENDayCycleDisplay​(greenfoot.Color colorDawn,
                           greenfoot.Color colorDay,
                           greenfoot.Color colorDusk,
                           greenfoot.Color colorNight,
                           greenfoot.Color colorSun,
                           greenfoot.Color colorMoon)
        Constructor that takes six Colors - for adjusting the colors of the sky, the moon, and the sun.

        Alpha values of the color parameters are ignored to ensure the best visuals.
        The color of the stars are the same as the color of the moon.
        Setting ColorDawn to ColorDay will make dawn appear to be day, effectively removing it.

        Parameters:
        colorDawn - Color of sky at dawn
        colorDay - Color of sky at day
        colorDusk - Color of sky at dusk
        colorNight - Color of sky at night
        colorSun - Color of sun
        colorMoon - Color of moon

      • VCENDayCycleDisplay

        public VCENDayCycleDisplay​(int numberOfStars,
                           int width,
                           int height,
                           int borderThickness,
                           greenfoot.Color colorBorder,
                           greenfoot.Color colorDawn,
                           greenfoot.Color colorDay,
                           greenfoot.Color colorDusk,
                           greenfoot.Color colorNight,
                           greenfoot.Color colorSun,
                           greenfoot.Color colorMoon)
        Constructor that takes four ints and seven Colors - for adjusting size and colors of the display: width and height of the display, size and color of the border, colors of the sky, the moon, and the sun.

        Alpha values of the color parameters are ignored to ensure the best visuals.
        The color of the stars are the same as the color of the moon.
        Setting ColorDawn to ColorDay will make dawn appear to be day, effectively removing it.

        Parameters:
        numberOfStars - Number of stars that appear at night, cannot be negative
        width - Width of display bar, must be greater than 0
        height - Height of display bar, must be greater than 0
        borderThickness - Width of border, cannot be negative
        colorBorder - Color of border
        colorDawn - Color of sky at dawn
        colorDay - Color of sky at day
        colorDusk - Color of sky at dusk
        colorNight - Color of sky at night
        colorSun - Color of sun
        colorMoon - Color of moon

      • VCENDayCycleDisplay

        public VCENDayCycleDisplay​(int timeNow,
                           int oneDayLength,
                           int dayTimeStart,
                           int duskTimeStart,
                           int nightTimeStart,
                           int numberOfStars,
                           int width,
                           int height,
                           int borderThickness,
                           greenfoot.Color colorBorder,
                           greenfoot.Color colorDawn,
                           greenfoot.Color colorDay,
                           greenfoot.Color colorDusk,
                           greenfoot.Color colorNight,
                           greenfoot.Color colorSun,
                           greenfoot.Color colorMoon)
        Constructor that takes nine ints and seven colors - they determine at what time the display starts, adjust the length of a day, when day, dusk, and night starts, the size of the display as well as the size of the border, and the colors of the border, sky, sun, and moon.

        Dawn is set to 0 (dawn always starts the day).
        Alpha values of the color parameters are ignored to ensure the best visuals.
        The color of the stars are the same as the color of the moon

        Warning: setting dayTimeStart to 0 will remove dawn. However, this is not recommended, because the visuals look less appealing. Similarily, setting duskTimeStart to dayTimeStart removes day, nightTimeStart to duskTimeStart removes dusk, and nightTimeStart to oneDayLength removes night. These are all not recommended actions.
        Instead, setting ColorDawn to ColorDay will make dawn appear to be day, effectively removing it. This is the recommended method to removing a time range.

        Parameters:
        timeNow - Time now
        oneDayLength - Length of a day (cycle), cannot be negative
        dayTimeStart - Time when day starts, must be between 0 and oneDayLength
        duskTimeStart - Time when dusk starts, must be between dayTimeStart and oneDayLength
        nightTimeStart - Time when night starts, must be between duskTimeStart and oneDayLength
        numberOfStars - Number of stars that appear at night, cannot be negative
        width - Width of display bar, must be greater than 0
        height - Height of display bar, must be greater than 0
        borderThickness - Width of border, cannot be negative
        colorBorder - Color of border
        colorDawn - Color of sky at dawn
        colorDay - Color of sky at day
        colorDusk - Color of sky at dusk
        colorNight - Color of sky at night
        colorSun - Color of sun
        colorMoon - Color of moon

      • update

        public void update​(int time)
        Updates the visuals based on the given time. Will do nothing if the given time is the same as the previously given time.
        Parameters:
        time - Time now

        colorMoon - Color of moon

      • update

        public void update​(int time,
                   int dayTimeStart,
                   int duskTimeStart,
                   int nightTimeStart)
        Updates the visuals based on the given time and adjusts when day, dusk, and night starts.

        Dawn is set to 0 (dawn always starts the day).

        Parameters:
        time - Time now
        dayTimeStart - Time when day starts, must be between 0 and oneDayLength
        duskTimeStart - Time when dusk starts, must be between dayTimeStart and oneDayLength
        nightTimeStart - Time when night starts, must be between duskTimeStart and oneDayLength

      • update

        public void update​(int width,
                   int height,
                   int borderThickness)
        Updates the size of the display by changing the width, height, and borderThickness.

        None of the values may be negative.

        Parameters:
        width - Width of display bar, must be greater than 0
        height - Height of display bar, must be greater than 0
        borderThickness - Width of border, cannot be negative
